snippet: The wife of Bo Xilai, who had been seen as one of the handful of rising leaders slated to run China, is being investigated in the killing of a businessman, Neil Heywood, last year.
abstract: Mysterious death of British businessman Neil Heywood in China in 2011 is thrust to the center of the political scandal surrounding former Communist Party official Bo Xilai, as the authorities declare the death a murder and name Bo's wife Gu Kailai as the leading suspect; the case is the most sensational in a series of charges against the family of Bo, who was once seen as being among the handful of rising leaders slated to run China.

byline.original: By SHARON LAFRANIERE, JOHN F. BURNS and JONATHAN ANSFIELD
byline.contributor: Sharon LaFraniere and Jonathan Ansfield reported from Beijing, and John F. Burns from London. Ravi Somaiya contributed reporting from London, and Michael Wines from Beijing. Edy Lin, Li Bibo and Mai Li contributed research.

lead_paragraph: The wife of Bo Xilai, who had been seen as one of the handful of rising leaders slated to run China, is being investigated in the killing of a businessman, Neil Heywood, last year.

headline.seo: Briton’s Death Is Thrust to Center of China Scandal Over Bo Xilai
headline.main: Death of a Briton Is Thrust to Center of China Scandal
headline.print_headline: China Scandal’s Latest Twist Revives Case of Dead Briton
